Subject Matter: Fingal County Council Draft Development Plan 2023-2028
Intended Results: The possibility of rezoning a parcel of land from HT (High Technology) to GE (General Employment) was discussed however, it was decided not to proceed with this rezoning. This land is approximated 25 acres and is located at Stockhole Lane, Clonshaugh, Dublin 17 behind the Clayton Hotel Dublin Airport.
Lobbying Activities: Overview email sent detailing potential request to rezone site from HT to GE, requesting a follow up meeting or phonecall.|Email|11-20::Spoke by phone with a number of councillors to discuss the possibility of rezoning site from HT to GE. This rezoning request was ultimately not proceeded with.|Phone call|2-5::Met with one councillor to discuss the possibility of rezoning site from HT to GE. This rezoning request was ultimately not proceeded with.|Meeting|1

Specific Details: Mental Health Irelands, Thrive Action Researcher Viola Di Bucchianico, lobbied for support from local councillors and TD's for a community event as follows: Thrive Swords hosted their Five Ways to Wellbeing community workshop Thursday 24th October in the Carnegie Court Hotel, Swords to celebrate Mental Health Month. This open-to-the-public event was attended by members of the local community as well as representatives of local groups, service providers, and local authorities.
DPOs Lobbied: Joe Newman|Councillor|Fingal County Council::Dean Mulligan|Councillor|Fingal County Council::Darren Jack Kelly|Councillor|Fingal County Council::James Humphreys|Councillor|Fingal County Council::Luke Corkery|Councillor|Fingal County Council::Darragh Butler|Councillor|Fingal County Council::Ann Graves|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Mental Health Irelands, Thrive Action Researcher Viola Di Bucchianico, lobbied for support from local councillors and TD's for a community event as follows: Thrive Swords hosted their Five Ways to Wellbeing community workshop Thursday 24th October in the Carnegie Court Hotel, Swords to celebrate Mental Health Month. This open-to-the-public event was attended by members of the local community as well as representatives of local groups, service providers, and local authorities.
Intended Results: Support for Thrive Swords, which can be offered by sharing details of the event, promoting the event or attendance at the event.
Lobbying Activities: Thrive Swords. Mental Health and Wellbeing. Community event. |Email|1
